article_text:
After months of chatter about a possible deal, Apple Inc. acquired Israel's PrimeSense Ltd., a sign of the iPhone maker's interest in new interactive technologies for its devices.

Apple paid about $350 million for PrimeSense, a person familiar with the acquisition said. The Israeli startup's technology supports the Kinect motion-sensing feature in Microsoft Corp.'s Xbox 360 game console.

An Apple spokeswoman confirmed the deal...
